meanings.definition: The act of chaining or binding together.
meanings.sent1: The enchainments of the prisoners prevented their escape.
meanings.sent2: The enchainments of the fence were strong and secure.
meanings.sent3: The enchainments of the jump rope competition were surprisingly entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The enchainments of love and trust held their relationship together.
meanings.sent5: The enchainments of the puzzle pieces made it challenging to solve.

meanings.definition: A series of connected or linked events or actions.
meanings.sent1: The enchainments of the story kept the readers engaged.
meanings.sent2: The enchainments of the investigation led to a breakthrough.
meanings.sent3: The enchainments of the cooking show made for an interesting episode.
meanings.sent4: The enchainments of fate seemed to guide their paths together.
meanings.sent5: The enchainments of the dance routine flowed seamlessly from one move to the next.
